channel.title: Favourite Half-Life 1 tracks
channel.description:
Had to be done eventually... tell me your heart doesn't quiver in delight when a certain tune pops up! Cast one vote for as many tracks as you prefer.
Although Track 11 is truly awesome, by carrying on with the Valve intro that made us fall in love with the game before even playing it, I've *gotta* vote for [i]Vague Voices[/i] just because it affirmed my intrigue in this game for life.
I'm also voting for [i]Hurricane Strings[/i], since I woke up on the morning Hurricane Dennis was going to hit our house, turned on my MP3 player, and had it aptly pop up first thing (via shuffle).
Oh, and [i]Threatening Short[/i] is truly threatening.
[FONT='Tahoma']2 votes for: [i]02. Adrenaline Horror[/i] 4 votes for: [i]03. Vague Voices[/i] 3 votes for: [i]04. Klaxon Beat[/i] 0 votes for: [i]05. Space Ocean[/i] 0 votes for: [i]06. Cavern Ambience[/i] 0 votes for: [i]07. Apprehensive Short[/i] 0 votes for: [i]08. Bass String Short[/i] 1 votes for: [i]09. Hurricane Strings[/i] 4 votes for: [i]10. Diabolical Adrenaline Guitar[/i] 6 votes for: [i]11. Valve Theme (Long Version)[/i] 2 votes for: [i]12. Nepal Monastery[/i] 0 votes for: [i]13. Alien Shock[/i] 1 votes for: [i]14. Sirens in The Distance[/i] 7 votes for: [i]15. Nuclear Mission Jam[/i] 0 votes for: [i]16. Scared Confusion Short[/i] 1 votes for: [i]17. Drums and Riffs[/i] 4 votes for: [i]18. Hard Technology Rock[/i] 1 votes for: [i]19. Steam in The Pipes[/i] 4 votes for: [i]20. Electric Guitar Ambience[/i] 2 votes for: [i]21. Dimensionless Deepness[/i] 2 votes for: [i]22. Military Precision[/i] 0 votes for: [i]23. Jungle Drums[/i] 0 votes for: [i]24. Traveling Through Limbo[/i] 5 votes for: [i]25. Credits Closing Theme[/i] 1 votes for: [i]26. Threatening Short[/i] 0 votes for: [i]27. Dark Piano Short[/i] 0 votes for: [i]28. Sharp Fear Short[/i][/FONT]
On the subject, anyone notice how reality television *loves* to use the same intro sound bits as featured in [i]Adrenaline Horror[/i]?

item.title: Favourite Half-Life 1 tracks
item.dc:creator: Floyd
item.description:
raw_bean:

Yeah, it’s CD audio. I remember if you ever left a different audio CD in the drive when playing it you’d get a surprise.

That reminds me of a very strange thing that happened when I was playing Half-Life once. I was playing it with Steam (no CD), and the map had just changed to the area of Surface Tension where you come across a 50cal and the spawning vorts. Black Sabbath’s War Pigs started playing completely randomly as though it was part of the game’s music - I had no CD in and it wasn’t up on WMP to begin with. I was playing and the sirens came up and it was a definite wtf moment, but still pretty cool. I played along with it for a while and it actually suited it pretty well. Ever happened to anyone?

Read full topic

item.title: Favourite Half-Life 1 tracks
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
There’s at least 2 episodes of South Park where music that is found in Half-Life plays.

The first I can remember is one of the songs at the conclusion of the Woodland Critter Christmas special, when Santa takes out a shotgun.

[COLOR=‘Olive’]EDIT: It’s the song that plays when you get onto the lowering platform where it rains headcrabs into the garbage disposal thing below.

Read full topic

I’m starting to think my (copied) Half-Life CD doesn’t have the audio tracks… I don’t recall hearing music in the game

item.title: Favourite Half-Life 1 tracks
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Eric Fong:

Can anyone tell me how to find the music in this video?
btw it is different from original music.

ODB is right, it is pretty much Diabolical Adrenaline Guitar without as much guitar… and I must say it will be hell to track down an MP3 the same variety as from that trailer.

Now, my memory isn’t crystal clear on this, but I could have sworn someone tried remaking that song. Unfortunately I don’t have the product of their labours, nor do I remember where they posted it. The internet is a large place

nubber:

i hear Nepal Monastery often on tv or somewhere else… do they justtake it, or is it something common ??

and i also heard the end credit song (or a different mix butnot the hl2 one)
in the southpark episode where the devil gives a birthday party ?ß

can anyone confirm these ?

I have heard Nepal Monastery’s flute melody used on television. I believe it’s from some audio collection which the Half-Life soundtrack also utilized, along with the opening theme from Adrenaline Horror.

And yes! I just watched that episode of South Park online, and I heard the background beat to the credits song! It also sounded as if there were some words to it… I wonder what sort of remix it was, or I wonder if it was actually original to Half-Life… hmm…

Read full topic

item.title: Favourite Half-Life 1 tracks
item.dc:creator: Floyd
item.description:
Sirens In The Distance is easily one of my favourites. I’m not sure why or how, but something about the music got underneath my guard when I descended into ‘On A Rail’ for the first time.

Dimensionless Deepness was also fantastic, just for communicating Xen to the player in such an efficient way. Napal Monastery was also brilliant, and fit perfectly with Blast Pit.

Others stand out as well, but those three sum up Half-Life for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Favourite Half-Life 1 tracks
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
Comrade Tiki:

Legally, no, but it does make an interesting ethical adjustment to the situation, a moral justification, as we humans cheer (and should cheer) for Robin of Loxley, who takes riches that are beyond attainability, no matter how much work is done, and distributes them to those that would never have it.

Which is why I rip and upload music and movies to the internet.

Praise me like a god.

Read full topic

item.title: Favourite Half-Life 1 tracks
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
LamboMan:

[COLOR=‘Red’]Well, the owner of that blog clearly states that he only puts up music that ISN’T commercially available anymore or wasn’t in the first place.

I always thought that the HL 1 soundtrack wasn’t available commercially and even that guy states that he had to extract that music from the game itself. Same for Op4’s soundtrack. [COLOR=‘Blue’]Correct me if i’m wrong, though…

Ok, i will agree about the HL2 soundtrack being pirated on that blog, but tell me, is it still commercially available anywhere?? And anyone with GCFscape could extract it from their legit copy of HL2…

Doesn’t matter if it’s commercially available or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Favourite Half-Life 1 tracks
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
LamboMan:

[COLOR=‘Red’]Well, the owner of that blog clearly states that he only puts up music that ISN’T commercially available anymore or wasn’t in the first place.

I always thought that the HL 1 soundtrack wasn’t available commercially and even that guy states that he had to extract that music from the game itself. Same for Op4’s soundtrack. [COLOR=‘Blue’]Correct me if i’m wrong, though…

Ok, i will agree about the HL2 soundtrack being pirated on that blog, but tell me, is it still commercially available anywhere?? And anyone with GCFscape could extract it from their legit copy of HL2…

He’s distributing games files. You aren’t allowed to rip DoD:S models from the game and post them on the internet as a gmod download, and the same goes for music.

Also, get your old HL1 or OP4 cd, and put it in your CD player. That’s right, it plays. It’s designed to sell the soundtrack with the game, and so both of them are commercially available.

What he’s doing is piracy.

Read full topic
